intro: Alchemilla glaberrima var. sericoneura, commonly known as the velvetleaf lady’s mantle, is a perennial plant native to the northeastern United States. It features basal leaves that are rounded and covered in a dense layer of soft, velvety hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in panicle-like clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are often used in herbal remedies due to their purported medicinal properties. The plant thrives in moist, shady environments and is commonly found in woodlands and along stream banks.
